sen.j: 崇道神社（すどうじんじゃ）は、京都市左京区上高野にある神社である。
sen.e: "Sudo-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Kamitakano, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
"Sudo-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Kamitakano, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
"Sudo-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Kamitakano, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Its shrine ranking is township shrine.
Its shrine ranking is township shrine.
Its shrine ranking is former township shrine.

sen.j: 社伝によれば、785年（延暦4年）9月長岡京造宮使であった藤原種継が暗殺された事件に連座したとされる早良親王（崇道天皇）の霊を慰めるため貞観 (日本)年間（859年～877年）に創建されたという。
sen.e: According to the historical document of the shrine, it was established in the Jogan era (Japan) (859 - 877) to comfort the spirit of Imperial Prince Sawara (Emperor Sudo), who was implicated in the incident where FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu, the Nagaokakyo zogushi, was assassinated in September 785.

According to the historical document on the shrine, it was established in the Jogan era (Japan) (859 - 877) to comfort the spirit of Imperial Prince Sawara (Emperor Sudo), who was implicated in an incident where FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu, the Nagaokakyo zogushi, was assassinated in September 785.

According to the historical document on the shrine, it was established in the Jogan era (Japan) (859 - 877) to comfort the spirit of Imperial Prince Sawara (Emperor Sudo), who was implicated in an incident where FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu, the Nagaokakyo zogushi (palace construction officer), was assassinated in September 785.
sen.cmt: 造宮使の補足を加えました。

sen.j: 1915年（大正4年）に近隣にあった式内社とされる出雲高野神社（祭神：玉依姫命）・伊多太神社（祭神：伊多太大神）・小野神社（祭神：小野妹子・小野毛人）の3社が合祀された。
sen.e: In 1915, three nearby shrines, Izumotakano-jinja Shrine (enshrined deity: Tamayorihime no mikoto), Itada-jinja Shrine (enshrined deity: Itada okami), and Ono-jinja Shrine (enshrined deity: ONO no Imoko and ONO no Emishi), which were considered to be shikinai-sha (shrine listed in the Engishiki (List of Official Shrines)), were enshrined together.

In 1915, three nearby shrines, Izumotakano-jinja Shrine (enshrined deity: Tamayorihime no mikoto), Itada-jinja Shrine (enshrined deity: Itada okami), and Ono-jinja Shrine (enshrined deity: ONO no Imoko and ONO no Emishi), which were considered to be shikinai-sha (shrine listed in the Engishiki (List of Official Shrines)), were enshrined together.

In 1915, three nearby shrines, Izumotakano-jinja Shrine (enshrined deity: Tamayorihime no mikoto), Itada-jinja Shrine (enshrined deity: Itada okami), and Ono-jinja Shrine (enshrined deities: ONO no Imoko and ONO no Emishi), which were considered to be shikinai-sha (shrines listed in the Engishiki (List of Official Shrines)), were enshrined together.
sen.cmt: 祭神が複数ある場合は、enshrined deitiesとしました。shikinai-shaの補足にあるshrineを複数形に修正しました。

sen.e: Kondo ONO no Emishi boshi (Gilt Bronze Memorial Tablet of ONO no Emishi)
sen.cmt: 英語の補足を加えました。(参照:http://www.kyohaku.go.jp/eng/syuzou/meihin/kouko/item09.html)

sen.j: 京都府京都市左京区上高野西明寺山町34
sen.e: 34 Kamitakanosaimyojiyama Town, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture
